author: James R. Hagerty
title: Rev. Wyatt Tee Walker Fought for Civil Rights With Martin Luther King Jr.
text:
In theory, there should have been no problem. It was a public library, and someone was checking out a book.
On Feb. 27, 1960, the Rev. Wyatt Tee Walker and other African-Americans protesting segregation entered the Petersburg, Va., library. Mr. Walker asked to borrow a biography of Robert E. Lee.
“I heard somebody say, ‘The niggers are here!’”...
